result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar Earl Howard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamar Earl Howard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Lamar Earl Howard.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials. Further, parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjourned status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Lamar Earl Howard not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Parties request additional time to work through discovery.  Court schedules a status conference to be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussions with parties regarding discovery issues. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to allot additional time for any outstanding discovery issues to be worked through. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Stipulation to the prior conviction in 16CF4670 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Kelly & MPD Officer A. Verreault. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Lamar Earl Howard not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel in the co-defendant matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Shalonn C.; Kristeena M.C.; Terry D.L.; Nora M.; and co-defendants:   Xavier Parks & William Pope
Officers J.L. Cruz & O.L. Sanders (unless in their official capacity as Milwaukee Police Officers)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Lamar Earl Howard in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamar Earl Howard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 19.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if hemeets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
